definition: high and mighty (idiom); arrogant
toe
high/tall/above average/loud/your (honorific)
surname Gao
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate

sentences.english: Those who act high-and-mighty always are usually left alone by others.
sentences.chinese: 別人往往不會和趾高氣揚的人過多交往。

sentences.english: Nor ought I to cease for an Instant to lavIsh upon her all that whIch she would dIsdaIn.
sentences.chinese: 儘管她趾高氣揚，我也不應當停止向她傾訴衷腸。

sentences.english: The high-salaried manager replaced the swaggering tycoon.
sentences.chinese: 高薪的經理代替了趾高氣揚的大老闆。

sentences.english: The pompous lecturer is strutting ago or toth over the stage.
sentences.chinese: 這個演說者在臺上趾高氣揚地來回走着。

sentences.english: Vic pranced into the office and demanded to speak to the manager.
sentences.chinese: 維克趾高氣揚地走進辦公室，要求和經理講話。

sentences.english: Galileo called the old strutting Aristotelian conservatives, The Pigeon League.
sentences.chinese: 伽利略稱趾高氣揚的亞斯多德派保守份子爲鴿盟。

sentences.english: He is puffed up with pride.
Leafs will be astrut in breeze but chill when gale makes them falling down.
sentences.chinese: 樹葉得勢時趾高氣揚，失意時威風掃地。

sentences.english: The male bird strutted in front of the female.
sentences.chinese: 雄鳥在雌鳥面前趾高氣揚地走着。

sentences.english: His father was peacocking about on the lawn.
sentences.chinese: 他的父親趾高氣揚在草地上來回地走。？

definition: to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
not to glance sideways (idiom)/to gaze fixedly/to be fully concentrated/to preserve a correct attitude
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
proud and arrogant
to obstruct/to impede
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
overbearing/arrogant bully
to play deaf-mute
to whisper to one another's ear
to upbraid
pleasure seeking (idiom); life of dissipation
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
battered and exhausted/stuck in a dilemma
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
